info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 449 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Santa Rosa Lake State Park, or 7 miles northeast of Santa Rosa, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Newkirk, Santa Rosa Lake State Park and Cuervo. This includes Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 272 and 302. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
